paper.title: Tabular Reinforcement Learning in Real-Time Strategy Games via Options
paper.abstract: Real-Time Strategy (RTS) games are complex domains with huge state and action spaces. In such games, humans usually pursue long-term plans, which take long sequences of actions to achieve. In this work, we implement this behavior by reasoning over options, which are temporally-extended actions in Markov Decision Processes. Our options are defined with the aid of a state aggregation scheme and a portfolio of game-playing algorithms. Experimentally, we show that our approach leverages the capabilities of traditional reinforcement-learning techniques, which become competitive against state-of-the-art search methods in mu RTS.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究在实时策略游戏（RTS）中通过选项进行表格强化学习，其核心技术和应用场景集中在游戏AI领域，并未涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融领域。
